intro: Perityle cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved perityle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Perityle cuneata thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
